BiquadFilterNode.summary: The BiquadFilterNode interface represents a simple low-order filter, and is created using the method. It is an that can represent different kinds of filters, tone control devices, and graphic equalizers. A BiquadFilterNode always has exactly one input and one output.

BiquadFilterNodeBiquadFilterNode.summary:
The BiquadFilterNode()
constructor of the Web Audio API
creates a new object, which represents a simple
low-order filter.

BiquadFilterNodeDetune.summary: The detune property of the interface is an a-rate representing detuning of the frequency in cents.
BiquadFilterNodeDetune.value:
An a-rate .
NOTEThough the AudioParam returned is read-only, the value it represents is not.

BiquadFilterNodeFrequency.summary: The frequency property of the interface is an a-rate — a double representing a frequency in the current filtering algorithm measured in hertz (Hz).

remarks.para: Its default value is 350, with a nominal range of 10 to the Nyquist frequency — that is, half of the sample rate.

BiquadFilterNodeFrequency.value:
An .
NOTEThough the AudioParam returned is read-only, the value it represents is not.

BiquadFilterNodeGain.summary: The gain property of the interface is an a-rate — a double representing the gain used in the current filtering algorithm.

remarks.para: When its value is positive, it represents a real gain; when negative, it represents an attenuation.
It is expressed in dB, has a default value of 0, and can take a value in a nominal range of -40 to 40.

BiquadFilterNodeGain.value:
An .
NOTEThough the AudioParam returned is read-only, the value it represents is not.

BiquadFilterNodeGetFrequencyResponse.summary: The getFrequencyResponse() method of the interface takes the current filtering algorithm's settings and calculates the frequency response for frequencies specified in a specified array of frequencies.

remarks.para:
The two output arrays, magResponseOutput and
phaseResponseOutput, must be created before calling this method; they
must be the same size as the array of input frequency values
(frequencyArray).

BiquadFilterNodeQ.summary: The Q property of the interface is an a-rate , a double representing a Q factor, or quality factor.
BiquadFilterNodeQ.value:
An . Its is 1, and its and are ±(2<sup>128</sup> - 2<sup>104</sup>), or approximately ±3.403e38. This is the range of single-precision floating-point numbers.Its actual value range depends on the filter's :
NOTEThough the AudioParam returned is read-only, the value it represents is not.

BiquadFilterNodeType.summary: The type property of the interface is a string (enum) value defining the kind of filtering algorithm the node is implementing.
